t: The*p oracle concerning the wilderness of the sea. As*pn whirlwinds in the Negeb sweep on, it*ld comes from the wilderness, from*ld a terrible land.
A*ln stern vision is told to me; the*ld traitor betrays, and*ld the destroyer destroys. Go*ln up, O Elam; lay*ld siege, O Media; all*ln the sighing she has caused I*ld bring to an end.
Therefore*ln my loins are filled with anguish; pangs*ld have seized me, like*ld the pangs of a woman in labor; I*ln am bowed down so that I cannot hear; I*ld am dismayed so that I cannot see.
My*ln heart staggers; horror has appalled me; the*ld twilight I longed for has*ld been turned for me into trembling.
They*ln prepare the table, they*ld spread the rugs, they*ld eat, they drink. Arise,*ln O princes; oil*ld the shield!
For*ln thus the Lord said to me: “Go,*ln set a watchman; let*ld him announce what he sees.
When*ln he sees riders, horsemen in pairs, riders*ld on donkeys, riders on camels, let*ln him listen diligently, very*ld diligently.”
Then*ln he who saw cried out: “Upon*ln a watchtower I stand, O Lord, continually*ld by day, and*ln at my post I am stationed whole*ld nights.
And*ln behold, here come riders, horsemen*ld in pairs!” And*ln he answered, “Fallen,*ld fallen is Babylon; and*ln all the carved images of her gods he*ld has shattered to the ground.”
O*ln my threshed and winnowed one, what*ld I have heard from the Lord*s of hosts, the*ld God of Israel, I announce to you.
The*p oracle concerning Dumah. One*pn is calling to me from Seir, “Watchman,*ld what time of the night? Watchman,*ld what time of the night?”
The*ln watchman says: “Morning*ln comes, and also the night. If*ld you will inquire, inquire; come*ld back again.”
The*p oracle concerning Arabia. In*pn the thickets in Arabia you will lodge, O*ld caravans of Dedanites.
To*ln the thirsty bring water; meet*ld the fugitive with bread, O*ld inhabitants of the land of Tema.
For*ln they have fled from the swords, from*ld the drawn sword, from*ln the bent bow, and*ld from the press of battle.
For*p thus the Lord said to me, “Within a year, according to the years of a hired worker, all the glory of Kedar will come to an end.
And the remainder of the archers of the mighty men of the sons of Kedar will be few, for the Lord,*s the God of Israel, has spoken.”
